description: Consolidated cheat sheet of key game knowledge - the stuff most players get wrong

tips.tip: Mythic decorations give +10% stats, Epic only +2.5%
tips.detail: Epic = 5 levels × 0.5% = 2.5% max. Mythic = 10 levels × 1% = 10% max. Skip straight to Mythic.

tips.tip: Build BOTH Attack and Defense Mythics for your main troop type
tips.detail: Infantry: Floating Market (+10% ATK) + Snow Castle (+10% DEF). Lancer: Amphitheatre + Elegant Villa. Marksman: Observation Deck + Art Gallery.

tips.tip: Decorations give bigger bonuses than Tree of Life
tips.detail: Two Mythic decorations = +20% for your troop type. Tree of Life L10 = only +5% Attack, +5% Defense universal.

tips.tip: Tree of Life combat buffs: L4 (DEF), L6 (ATK), L9 (HP), L10 (Lethality)
tips.detail: Each is +5%. L1-3, L5, L7-8 are just Healing Speed - rush past them.

tips.tip: Mythic decorations cost 10,000 Life Essence, give 10,000 Prosperity
tips.detail: Best Prosperity-per-Life-Essence ratio. Build L1 of all Mythics first, then level them.

tips.tip: SPEEDUPS ONLY GIVE POINTS ON DAY 1, 2, AND 5
tips.detail: Day 3 (Beast Slay) and Day 4 (Hero Development) give ZERO points for speedups. Save them!

tips.tip: General Hero Shards do NOT give points
tips.detail: Only NAMED hero shards (Jeronimo, Natalia, etc.) count. General shards = 0 points.

tips.tip: Day 4: Promote troops, don't train new ones
tips.detail: T9→T10 promotion: 0.71 pts/sec. T8→T9: 0.64 pts/sec. Training NEW T10: only 0.39 pts/sec. Promoting beats speedups.

tips.tip: Mithril = 40,000 points each on Day 4
tips.detail: NEVER use Mithril outside SvS Prep. Save every single one for Day 4.

tips.tip: Lucky Wheel = 8,000 points per spin on Day 2 or 3
tips.detail: Save all Lucky Wheel tickets for SvS Prep.

tips.tip: Fire Crystals = 2,000 points each on Day 1
tips.detail: Save ALL Fire Crystals and FC Shards for SvS Prep Day 1.

tips.tip: Building upgrades just need to START on that day
tips.detail: You don't need to finish the upgrade - just start it during the point window.

tips.tip: Prioritize Tool Enhancement at each tier (I-VII)
tips.detail: Each level gives incremental research speed bonuses (0.4%-2.5% per level). Total across I-VII is ~35%. Do Tool Enhancement before other research at each tier.

tips.tip: Lethality research is a damage MULTIPLIER
tips.detail: Attack and Lethality multiply together. +10% each = +21% damage. Prioritize Lethality over raw Attack.

tips.tip: Battle tree > Growth tree > Economy tree (after Tool Enhancement VII)
tips.detail: Economy tree is lowest priority. Only do it after Battle and Growth are solid.

tips.tip: Research your MAIN troop type first
tips.detail: If you're Infantry-focused, max Infantry Lethality/Attack/Defense before touching Marksman or Lancer.

tips.tip: Keep all 6 Chief Gear pieces at SAME TIER for set bonuses
tips.detail: 6-piece set bonus gives Attack to ALL troops. Don't max one piece while others lag behind - keep them even, then upgrade Infantry first.

tips.tip: Chief Gear priority: Infantry (Coat/Pants) > Marksman (Belt/Weapon) > Lancer (Cap/Watch)
tips.detail: When upgrading to next tier, do Infantry first. They're frontline and engage first in battle. Marksman are damage dealers. Lancer last.

tips.tip: Chief Gear > Hero Gear for most players
tips.detail: Chief Gear set bonuses affect ALL troops. Hero Gear only affects one hero. Prioritize Chief Gear unless you're a whale.

tips.tip: Each gear piece boosts ONE troop type only
tips.detail: Coat/Pants = Infantry. Belt/Weapon = Marksman. Cap/Watch = Lancer. No universal pieces exist - set bonuses are the only way to boost all troops.

tips.tip: Upgrade all charms evenly for army-wide bonus
tips.detail: There's a hidden bonus for keeping charms at similar levels. Don't max one while ignoring others.

tips.tip: 6 charm slots match troop types
tips.detail: 2 Infantry (Coat, Pants), 2 Lancer (Cap, Watch), 2 Marksman (Belt, Weapon). Focus on your main type.

tips.tip: Unlocks at Furnace 25
tips.detail: Don't worry about charms until F25. After that, they're a significant stat source.

tips.tip: Rally joining: ONLY leftmost hero's expedition skill applies
tips.detail: Put Jessie (+25% DMG) or Jeronimo in leftmost slot. Other heroes' expedition skills are wasted.

tips.tip: Exploration skills for PvE, Expedition skills for PvP
tips.detail: Bear Trap, Labyrinth = Exploration. SvS, rallies, Crazy Joe, garrison = Expedition. Don't mix them up.

tips.tip: Sergey in leftmost slot for DEFENSE
tips.detail: Sergey's -20% DMG taken is best defensive skill. Use him when reinforcing garrisons.

tips.tip: Class counters: Infantry > Lancer > Marksman > Infantry
tips.detail: 10% attack bonus against weak class. Match your composition to counter enemy's main type.

tips.tip: Troop quantity has diminishing returns
tips.detail: Damage scales with sqrt(troops). Doubling troops = only 41% more damage. Quality > quantity.

tips.tip: Activate combat pets BEFORE battles
tips.detail: Saber-tooth Tiger (+10% Lethality), Mammoth (+10% Defense), Frost Gorilla (+10% Health). 2-hour buffs.

tips.tip: Pet level matters - L100 gives ~2x the buff of L50
tips.detail: Don't just own combat pets, level them. Higher level = bigger percentage buff.

tips.tip: S-tier pets: Saber-tooth, Mammoth, Frost Gorilla, Iron Rhino, Snow Ape
tips.detail: These unlock at 200-370 server days. Worth investing in when available.

tips.tip: NEVER spend Flames outside Flame Lotto
tips.detail: Save every single Flame for Flame Lotto event. Best value for flame currency.

tips.tip: Snowbusters and Fishing are pay-to-progress
tips.detail: F2P players hit a wall quickly. Do free attempts only, don't buy packs for these.

tips.tip: Bear Trap is S-tier for F2P
tips.detail: Best rewards for effort. Always participate. Use EXPLORATION skills team (not expedition).

tips.tip: Only craft gear during Artisan's Trove
tips.detail: Save all crafting materials. Bonus rewards during event make it worth waiting.

tips.tip: Wood/Meat/Iron/Coal inflate pack % values
tips.detail: These basic resources have near-zero real value. A '500% value' pack is often 80% filler.

tips.tip: Look for Essence Stones, Legendary Shards, Speedups
tips.detail: These are S/A-tier resources. Packs without them are usually bad value.

tips.tip: Compare gems-per-dollar across pack tiers
tips.detail: Higher price tier isn't always better value. Calculate useful_gems / price.

tips.tip: Don't invest in heroes that will be replaced next generation
tips.detail: Check hero tier lists. S+ heroes (Jeronimo, Blanchette, Wu Ming) stay relevant. B/C tier heroes get replaced.

tips.tip: Jessie is the best rally joiner in the game
tips.detail: +25% DMG dealt to all troops at max expedition skill. Even at low investment, her expedition skill is top tier. MAX HER EXPEDITION SKILL FIRST.

tips.tip: Sergey is the best garrison joiner
tips.detail: -20% damage taken for ENTIRE garrison at max expedition skill. Critical for defense. MAX HIS EXPEDITION SKILL.

tips.tip: Philly is essential for PvE content
tips.detail: Best healer until Gen 13 Flora. Healer critical for exploration, Bear Trap. Max her EXPLORATION skills.

tips.tip: F2P: Focus resources on 3-4 core heroes maximum
tips.detail: Spread resources = weak everywhere. Pick Jeronimo + Wu Ming + 1 Lancer + 1 Marksman. Max them before touching others.

tips.tip: Expedition skills for PvP, Exploration skills for PvE
tips.detail: Rallies, SvS, garrison, Crazy Joe = expedition skills (right side). Bear Trap, exploration = exploration skills (left side).

1.summary: Foundation heroes - Jeronimo & Jessie stay meta forever

heroes.name: Jeronimo
heroes.why: Best rally leader in the game. His expedition skills boost all Infantry damage and stay relevant at every level of play.
heroes.skills: MAX all 3 expedition skills - Infantry Offense, Infantry Defense, and Infantry Health buffs all stack with your troops.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta. Still #1 rally leader even against Gen 14 heroes.

heroes.name: Natalia
heroes.why: Solid frontline tank with good sustain. Feral Protection provides damage reduction. Has mythic gear for late-game scaling.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills if you need another Infantry. Gets replaced by Gen 6+ Infantry but mythic gear keeps her relevant.
heroes.longevity: Useful until Gen 6 Wu Ming. Mythic gear gives her late-game niche.

heroes.name: Molly
heroes.why: B-tier Lancer but has mythic gear. Worth keeping for late-game mythic investment if you lack better Lancers.
heroes.skills: Only invest if you're building her mythic gear. Otherwise skip for Norah/Gordon.
heroes.longevity: Mythic gear gives late-game potential. Otherwise outclassed by S-tier Lancers.

heroes.name: Zinman
heroes.why: C-tier Marksman but has mythic gear. Only invest if you're a whale building all mythic heroes.
heroes.skills: Skip unless going for mythic gear completion.
heroes.longevity: Weak hero but mythic gear exists. Whales only.

heroes.name: Jessie
heroes.why: Best rally JOINER in the game. Her top-right expedition skill 'Stand of Arms' gives +25% damage dealt to the entire rally.
heroes.skills: MAX 'Stand of Arms' (top-right expedition skill) to level 5 for +25% damage. Other skills are lower priority.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta as a joiner. You'll use her in slot 1 for every attack rally you join.

heroes.name: Sergey
heroes.why: Best GARRISON joiner. His 'Defenders Edge' expedition skill reduces damage taken by the entire garrison by up to 20%.
heroes.skills: MAX 'Defenders Edge' (top-right expedition skill). Skip exploration skills entirely.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta as garrison joiner. Put in slot 1 when defending.

heroes.name: Bahiti
heroes.why: Decent early Marksman but outclassed quickly. A-tier expedition gives some value.
heroes.skills: Only invest if no better Marksman available.
heroes.longevity: Replace with Gen 5 Gwen or any S-tier Marksman.

heroes.name: Jasser
heroes.why: Similar to Bahiti - early Marksman option with A-tier expedition.
heroes.skills: Skip. Save resources for S-tier Marksmen.
heroes.longevity: Replace with Gwen (Gen 5) or Bradley (Gen 7).

heroes.name: Patrick
heroes.why: Early Lancer option with A-tier expedition. Nothing special.
heroes.skills: Skip. Better Lancers come in Gen 5+.
heroes.longevity: Replace with Norah (Gen 5) or Gordon (Gen 7).

heroes.name: Ling Xue
heroes.why: B-tier Lancer without standout skills. Better options available.
heroes.skills: Skip entirely.
heroes.longevity: Outclassed by Patrick and all S-tier Lancers.

heroes.name: Lumak Bokan
heroes.why: B-tier Infantry without the expedition value of Sergey.
heroes.skills: Skip. Sergey is better for joining, Jeronimo/Natalia for leading.
heroes.longevity: No niche. Skip.

heroes.name: Gina
heroes.why: C-tier Marksman. Bahiti and Jasser are better early options.
heroes.skills: Skip entirely.
heroes.longevity: No use case. Skip.

heroes.name: Seo-yoon
heroes.why: C-tier Marksman. Same as Gina - no reason to invest.
heroes.skills: Skip entirely.
heroes.longevity: No use case. Skip.

heroes.name: Smith
heroes.why: Gathering hero only - Iron. Zero combat value.
heroes.skills: Don't waste ANY resources.
heroes.longevity: Never use in combat. Only for resource gathering on farm accounts.

heroes.name: Eugene
heroes.why: Gathering hero only - Wood. Zero combat value.
heroes.skills: Don't waste ANY resources.
heroes.longevity: Never use in combat. Only for resource gathering on farm accounts.

heroes.name: Charlie
heroes.why: Gathering hero only - Coal. Zero combat value.
heroes.skills: Don't waste ANY resources.
heroes.longevity: Never use in combat. Only for resource gathering on farm accounts.

heroes.name: Cloris
heroes.why: Gathering hero only - Meat. Zero combat value.
heroes.skills: Don't waste ANY resources.
heroes.longevity: Never use in combat. Only for resource gathering on farm accounts.

2.summary: Philly is the best healer until Gen 13 - invest heavily in exploration skills

heroes.name: Philly
heroes.why: Best healer in the game until Flora (Gen 13). Her exploration skills provide massive healing in PvE content.
heroes.skills: MAX all EXPLORATION skills. Her expedition skills are mediocre - focus on exploration for healing.
heroes.longevity: Meta healer until Gen 13 Flora. Even then, still usable as backup.

heroes.name: Alonso
heroes.why: Solid Marksman DPS. Good bridge hero until Gen 5+ Marksmen.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP. Replaced by Gwen (Gen 5) or Bradley (Gen 7).
heroes.longevity: Usable until Gen 7-8. Then becomes backup.

heroes.name: Flint
heroes.why: Backup Infantry tank. Not bad, but not essential.
heroes.skills: Only invest if you need Infantry depth.
heroes.longevity: Replaced by Wu Ming (Gen 6). Skip if resources are tight.

3.summary: All A-tier heroes - use as bridges but don't over-invest

heroes.name: Logan
heroes.why: Good Infantry with S-tier expedition rating. Provides solid troop buffs.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills have value. But Gen 6 Wu Ming is much better.
heroes.longevity: Bridge hero. Usable until Gen 6.

heroes.name: Mia
heroes.why: Decent Lancer but not special.
heroes.skills: Only invest if you need Lancer depth.
heroes.longevity: Replaced by Norah (Gen 5) or Gordon (Gen 7).

heroes.name: Greg
heroes.why: Serviceable Marksman. Nothing wrong with him.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills if needed.
heroes.longevity: Replaced by Gwen (Gen 5) or better.

4.summary: Skip generation - Gen 5 has much better options

heroes.name: Ahmose
heroes.why: Passively collect shards but don't invest. Wu Ming (Gen 6) is far superior.
heroes.skills: Save your resources.
heroes.longevity: Outclassed by Gen 5-6. Skip.

heroes.name: Reina
heroes.why: Norah (Gen 5) comes right after and is S-tier.
heroes.skills: Save your resources.
heroes.longevity: Skip for Norah.

heroes.name: Lynn
heroes.why: Gwen (Gen 5) is coming and is S-tier.
heroes.skills: Save your resources.
heroes.longevity: Skip for Gwen.

5.summary: First S-tier generation! Norah and Gwen are excellent investments

heroes.name: Norah
heroes.why: Balanced offensive AND defensive buffs. -15% damage taken AND +15% damage dealt makes her versatile.
heroes.skills: MAX expedition skills. Her top-right skill is excellent for joining.
heroes.longevity: Long-term value. S+ expedition tier means she stays relevant.

heroes.name: Gwen
heroes.why: First S-tier Marksman. Solid DPS upgrade over all previous Marksmen.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP damage.
heroes.longevity: Usable until Gen 8+ Marksmen. Good value.

heroes.name: Hector
heroes.why: A-tier overall but S-tier expedition. Good Infantry if you need depth.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills have value.
heroes.longevity: Backup to Wu Ming (Gen 6). Don't over-invest.

6.summary: Wu Ming is TOP 3 hero in the game - MAX EVERYTHING

heroes.name: Wu Ming
heroes.why: Top 3 hero in the entire game. -25% ALL damage taken is unmatched sustain. Best defensive Infantry ever.
heroes.skills: MAX ALL skills. Every expedition skill is valuable. He's worth every resource.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta. Even Gen 14 doesn't replace him for pure defense.

heroes.name: Renee
heroes.why: Infantry ATK boost benefits your Infantry troops. Good synergy with Wu Ming and Jeronimo.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for Infantry buff.
heroes.longevity: Long-term value with Infantry-focused builds.

heroes.name: Wayne
heroes.why: Only A-tier in a generation with an S+ hero. Skip unless you desperately need Marksman depth.
heroes.skills: Save resources for better Marksmen.
heroes.longevity: Outclassed by Gen 7-8 Marksmen.

7.summary: All three heroes are S-tier - solid generation

heroes.name: Gordon
heroes.why: Poison damage is devastating in rallies. Best Lancer for sustained damage over time.
heroes.skills: MAX expedition skills. Poison stacks make him excellent for long fights.
heroes.longevity: Rally specialist. Long-term value.

heroes.name: Edith
heroes.why: 3/3 sustain skills make her incredibly tanky. Great complement to Wu Ming.
heroes.skills: All expedition skills provide sustain buffs.
heroes.longevity: Solid Infantry depth. Long-term backup to Wu Ming.

heroes.name: Bradley
heroes.why: First S-tier Marksman with well-rounded skills. Solid ranged DPS.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP damage.
heroes.longevity: Usable until Gen 10 Blanchette. Good investment.

8.summary: Hendrik has S+ expedition rating - best single-target DPS

heroes.name: Gatot
heroes.why: Pure defense specialist. 3/3 sustain skills stack for maximum tankiness.
heroes.skills: All skills are defensive. Great for garrison and long fights.
heroes.longevity: Defensive specialist. Long-term Infantry depth.

heroes.name: Hendrik
heroes.why: S+ expedition tier - best single-target DPS Marksman until Blanchette (Gen 10).
heroes.skills: MAX expedition skills. His single-target damage is unmatched.
heroes.longevity: Long-term value. S+ expedition means relevance even late game.

heroes.name: Sonya
heroes.why: Offense-focused Lancer. Good damage but less utility than Gordon.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for attack buffs.
heroes.longevity: Good Lancer option. Complements Gordon's poison.

9.summary: Magnus is S+ Infantry - another must-have hero

heroes.name: Magnus
heroes.why: S+ Infantry with excellent all-around skills. Top-tier frontline hero.
heroes.skills: MAX all expedition skills. Every skill provides value.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta. S+ tier doesn't get replaced easily.

heroes.name: Xura
heroes.why: Solid S-tier Marksman. Good damage and utility.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP.
heroes.longevity: Usable until Blanchette (Gen 10). Good bridge.

heroes.name: Fred
heroes.why: Only A-tier in a generation with an S+ hero. Skip unless you need Lancer depth.
heroes.skills: Save resources.
heroes.longevity: Outclassed by S-tier Lancers.

10.summary: Blanchette is THE best Marksman in the game - MAX EVERYTHING

heroes.name: Blanchette
heroes.why: Best Marksman in the entire game. S+ expedition tier. Highest DPS output possible.
heroes.skills: MAX ALL skills. She's the Marksman equivalent of Jeronimo and Wu Ming.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta. Best Marksman even against Gen 14.

heroes.name: Freya
heroes.why: Strong S-tier Lancer. Good offensive capabilities.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for damage.
heroes.longevity: Long-term Lancer value.

heroes.name: Gregory
heroes.why: A-tier Infantry in a generation with an S+ Marksman. You have Wu Ming and Magnus already.
heroes.skills: Skip unless you need Infantry depth.
heroes.longevity: Outclassed by S+ Infantry.

11.summary: Rufus is solid S-tier Marksman, Lloyd has S expedition

heroes.name: Rufus
heroes.why: Good S-tier Marksman but you likely have Blanchette already.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills if you need Marksman depth.
heroes.longevity: Good backup to Blanchette.

heroes.name: Lloyd
heroes.why: A-tier overall but S expedition. Good joiner potential.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for joining rallies.
heroes.longevity: Niche use as joiner. Not essential.

heroes.name: Eleonora
heroes.why: A-tier Infantry when you have Wu Ming and Magnus.
heroes.skills: Skip unless you need depth.
heroes.longevity: Backup only.

12.summary: Hervor is S+ Infantry - another max investment hero

heroes.name: Hervor
heroes.why: S+ Infantry. Excellent skills that rival Wu Ming and Magnus.
heroes.skills: MAX all expedition skills. S+ heroes are always worth maxing.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta. Third S+ Infantry in your lineup.

heroes.name: Karol
heroes.why: Strong S-tier Lancer. Good all-around skills.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP.
heroes.longevity: Long-term Lancer value.

heroes.name: Ligeia
heroes.why: S-tier Marksman. Good backup to Blanchette.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills if you need Marksman depth.
heroes.longevity: Solid Marksman depth.

13.summary: Vulcanus is S+ Marksman, Flora is the new best healer

heroes.name: Vulcanus
heroes.why: S+ Marksman. Rivals Blanchette for damage output.
heroes.skills: MAX all expedition skills. Two S+ Marksmen means devastating DPS.
heroes.longevity: Forever meta alongside Blanchette.

heroes.name: Flora
heroes.why: NEW BEST HEALER. Replaces Philly for PvE content. Massive healing output.
heroes.skills: MAX EXPLORATION skills for healing. Her expedition skills are secondary.
heroes.longevity: New meta healer. Philly becomes backup.

heroes.name: Gisela
heroes.why: A-tier Infantry when you have three S+ Infantry already.
heroes.skills: Skip unless you need depth.
heroes.longevity: Backup only.

14.summary: Elif is S+ Infantry - latest and one of the best

heroes.name: Elif
heroes.why: Latest S+ Infantry. Fourth S+ Infantry option. Excellent skills.
heroes.skills: MAX all expedition skills. S+ Infantry are always meta.
heroes.longevity: Current meta. Future-proof investment.

heroes.name: Dominic
heroes.why: Strong S-tier Lancer. Good all-around performance.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills for PvP.
heroes.longevity: Long-term Lancer value.

heroes.name: Cara
heroes.why: S-tier Marksman. Good but you have Blanchette and Vulcanus.
heroes.skills: Expedition skills if you need Marksman depth.
heroes.longevity: Third Marksman option.

spending_advice.f2p: Focus on 1-2 heroes per generation MAX. Prioritize S+ heroes: Jeronimo, Jessie (expedition only), Wu Ming, Magnus, Blanchette. Skip entire generations (Gen 4) to save resources.
spending_advice.minnow: Invest in all S+ heroes and 1 S-tier per generation. Skip A-tier heroes unless desperate for class depth.
spending_advice.dolphin: Invest in all S+ and S-tier heroes. A-tier heroes only as bridges while waiting for better options.
spending_advice.whale: MAX all S+ heroes. HIGH investment in all S-tier. Use A-tier as needed for depth and variety.

tips.tip: Alliance tech gives permanent stat boosts
tips.detail: Join an active alliance that researches combat tech. Dead alliances = missing free stats.

tips.tip: Donate to alliance tech daily
tips.detail: Your donations help unlock tech bonuses that benefit YOU. Don't skip this.

tips.tip: Check alliance tech before joining
tips.detail: A strong alliance's tech advantage is permanent while you're a member.

tips.tip: SHIELD UP during entire Battle Phase unless actively fighting
tips.detail: Enemies can teleport to your state and attack unshielded cities. They get points for killing your troops.

tips.tip: Attacking or joining rally DROPS your shield for 30 minutes
tips.detail: You can't re-shield for 30 min after attacking. Time your attacks carefully or you become a target.

tips.tip: Losing SvS = enemy can become Supreme President of BOTH states
tips.detail: If enemy captures your Sunfire Castle, their alliance leader rules both states. Your president is removed.

tips.tip: Field Triage recovers 30-90% of troops lost in SvS
tips.detail: Base 30% recovery. Use Rebirth Tomes with allies to increase up to 90%. Coordinate with alliance.

tips.tip: Reinforce offline alliance members who forgot to shield
tips.detail: Send troops to garrison allies without shields. Stops enemies from farming free kills.

tips.tip: Bookmark weak enemy targets BEFORE battle starts
tips.detail: Scout enemy state during prep phase. Mark easy targets so you're ready when portals open.

tips.tip: Hero Power (Essence Stones) and Research are the REAL long-term investments
tips.detail: In mid/late game, these give permanent, multiplicative stat boosts that affect all combat. This is where serious players concentrate.

tips.tip: Troop Power is FAKE power
tips.detail: Having more troops seems great... until you have enough. Once you hit troop caps for rallies/marches, extra troops just sit there. Quality beats quantity.

tips.tip: Damage scales with square root of troops
tips.detail: Doubling your troops only gives +41% damage. But +10% Lethality from research? That's +10% forever on every fight.

tips.tip: Essence Stones boost Hero Gear Mastery permanently
tips.detail: Each mastery level is a permanent stat increase. This compounds with research, gear, and everything else.

tips.tip: Research bonuses multiply with everything
tips.detail: +10% Attack research × +10% Lethality research × hero skills × gear = massive combined effect. Research never goes away.

tips.tip: Stop training troops once you have enough for rallies
tips.detail: If you can fill rally slots and have reserves for losses, more troops = wasted resources. Invest in quality instead.

tips.tip: DON'T spend resources just because the red dot appears
tips.detail: The game shows upgrade notifications constantly. Ignore them. Save resources for KEY events, not every event.

tips.tip: Save ALL speedups for SvS Prep and Hall of Chiefs
tips.detail: These events give massive rewards for speedup usage. Using speedups randomly = wasted value.

tips.tip: Not all events are worth participating in
tips.detail: Snowbusters, Fishing = pay-to-progress traps. SvS Prep, Bear Trap, Hall of Chiefs = high value. Be selective.

tips.tip: Save Fire Crystals for SvS Prep Day 1 (2,000 pts each)
tips.detail: Don't use FC for building upgrades randomly. Hoard them for SvS Prep where they give huge points.

tips.tip: Save Mithril for SvS Prep Day 4 (40,000 pts each)
tips.detail: Mithril is extremely valuable during SvS. NEVER use it outside the event.

tips.tip: Save Lucky Wheel tickets for SvS Prep (8,000 pts per spin)
tips.detail: Don't spin Lucky Wheel randomly. Save tickets for Day 2/3 of SvS Prep for massive points.

tips.tip: Save Flames for Flame Lotto event ONLY
tips.detail: Never spend Flames outside Flame Lotto. The event gives much better value per Flame.

tips.tip: Early game: focus on Furnace level, not power
tips.detail: Furnace unlocks systems and troops. Power is meaningless if you're behind on Furnace level.

tips.tip: Keep Furnace burning at all times - set to MAX power
tips.detail: Never let your furnace run out of coal. Keep it on MAX power. Survivors freeze and become unhappy/sick without heat.

tips.tip: Upgrade Cookhouse to Fancy Meals immediately
tips.detail: Tap Cookhouse > Stove > menu icon > select Fancy Meal. Tiny meat cost increase, huge boost to survivor happiness and health.

tips.tip: Don't spread resources across all heroes
tips.detail: Focus on 5-8 core heroes. Spreading thin = weak everywhere. Concentrated investment = strong team.

tips.tip: Join events for participation rewards even if you can't compete
tips.detail: Many events give rewards just for participating. Don't skip entirely - get the free stuff.

tips.tip: Recycle duplicate Tundra Album fragments for tokens
tips.detail: Extra puzzle pieces can be recycled: 60 tokens = Rare pack, 120 = Epic, 250 = Mythic. Complete 10 scenes to unlock auto-assembly.

tips.tip: Exchange excess Hero Shards at Tundra Trading Station
tips.detail: Once heroes are max stars, trade extra shards for vouchers. Get Mythic Gear, Essence Stones, Enhancement XP.

tips.tip: Farm accounts = extra resource income for your main
tips.detail: A farm account gathers resources 24/7 that you transfer to your main account. Essential for F2P/Dolphins to keep pace with spenders.

tips.tip: Start farm accounts in the SAME STATE as your main
tips.detail: Resources can only be sent within your state. A farm in State 500 can't help your main in State 200.

tips.tip: Farm accounts don't need heroes, research, or gear
tips.detail: Only level Furnace and resource buildings. No combat investment needed - farms are just resource generators.

tips.tip: Farm accounts should stay under a shield 24/7
tips.detail: Farms are weak targets. Keep them shielded always. Send resources to main when shield is about to drop, then re-shield.

tips.tip: Aim for F18-F20 on farms, then stop
tips.detail: Higher furnace = better resource buildings, but diminishing returns. F18-F20 is the sweet spot for effort vs output.

tips.tip: Use VIP time on farms to boost gathering speed
tips.detail: Short VIP bursts (8h-24h) on farms greatly increase gather rates during active sessions.

tips.tip: Farm heroes: just use Smith, Eugene, Charlie, Cloris
tips.detail: Basic Epic heroes with gathering skills. Don't waste shards leveling farm heroes - keep investment minimal.

tips.tip: Transfer resources via Alliance Help feature
tips.detail: Both accounts must be in same alliance. Farm sends resource packages to main via alliance gift system.

tips.tip: R5 has full control; R4s assist with most management tasks
tips.detail: R5 can build/relocate HQ, transfer leadership, disband alliance. R4 can kick R1-R3, start Tech research, build structures, manage Championship lanes.

tips.tip: Mark recommended Alliance Tech with green 'ok' icon for +20% contribution rewards
tips.detail: When you endorse a tech, members get bonus contribution rewards. Coordinate which tech to prioritize.

tips.tip: Kick inactive players aggressively in new states
tips.detail: Early game has high player churn. Keep roster active to maintain top alliance status. Full roster of actives > partial roster of inactives.

tips.tip: Verify rally joiner heroes BEFORE starting rally
tips.detail: Use rally overview screen to check every joiner's first hero and skill ratings. Boot joiners who don't meet requirements.

tips.tip: Set rally times in advance and communicate in alliance chat
tips.detail: Assign roles, plan reinforcements, coordinate pet buffs. Preparation wins rallies more than raw power.

tips.tip: Alliance Championship: Assign lanes strategically
tips.detail: R4/R5 assign players to lanes. Analyze enemy setups, position players to match against weaker opponents. Poor arrangement = facing stronger foes.

tips.tip: Territory control requires 75% of farm's 2x2 area
tips.detail: Only R4/R5 can place Alliance Banner blueprints. May need multiple banners around a farm to claim it fully.

tips.tip: Joining a rally drops your shield for 30 minutes
tips.detail: Starting or joining a rally = exposed to attacks. Reinforcing does NOT drop shield. Plan accordingly during SvS.

tips.tip: Whitelist allows movement between specific alliances
tips.detail: Players can be on multiple whitelists. Use this for coordinating between allied alliances without rejection delays.

tips.tip: Attack and Lethality MULTIPLY together in the damage formula
tips.detail: Kills = sqrt(Troops) x (Attack x Lethality) / (Defense x Health). Since they multiply, investing in whichever stat is LOWER gives more damage per resource. Most accounts have Attack >> Lethality, so Lethality upgrades are almost always more efficient.

tips.tip: "Damage Dealt" buffs are the strongest buff type in the game
tips.detail: There are 3 types: Attack (boosts base stat), Normal Attack Damage (only auto-attacks), and Damage Dealt (multiplies EVERYTHING: troops, hero skills, pets, teammate buffs). Jessie's +25% Damage Dealt is a final multiplier on all damage.

tips.tip: Mixed joiner compositions mathematically outperform identical joiners
tips.detail: Hero skills have hidden categories (effect_op codes). Same category stacks additively, different categories multiply. 4x Jessie = 2.0x. 2 from one category + 2 from another = 1.5 x 1.5 = 2.25x (12.5% more damage).

tips.tip: Enemy debuffs benefit ALL rally participants — the biggest force multiplier
tips.detail: Renee's enemy_vuln, Vulcanus's enemy_def_debuff, and Gordon's enemy_vuln apply to every member's troops. In a 20-person rally, a 30% enemy debuff is far more valuable than a personal 30% buff.

tips.tip: Renee (Gen 6) has the strongest debuff in the game
tips.detail: Her Dreamcatcher skill applies 150% enemy vulnerability (50% uptime = 75% effective). In rallies, this benefits all participants. Top priority for rally leader lineups.

tips.tip: Rufus (Gen 11) is a stealth S++ hero
tips.detail: He simultaneously buffs infantry DMG +60%, marksman DMG +100%, AND debuffs enemy lethality -50% and enemy vulnerability +25%. One of only 2 heroes who can reduce enemy Lethality.

tips.tip: Blanchette is mathematically unique — the only hero with crit damage buff
tips.detail: +50% crit damage + 20% crit rate in the same kit. No other hero has crit_dmg_buff. Marksman rally (Blanchette + Vulcanus + Rufus) = 200% marksman DMG, 60% ATK, 50% crit DMG.

tips.tip: Exclusive gear bonuses (widgets) do NOT work when joining rallies
tips.detail: Rally leaders get full widget benefits. Garrison defenders get defensive widgets. Rally JOINERS get zero widget benefit. Exclusive gear on joiner-only heroes is wasted.

tips.tip: Exclusive skills use DUAL math — both additive AND multiplicative
tips.detail: Regular stats stack purely additively. But exclusive skills and buff items apply +X% additive AND xX% multiplicative simultaneously. Makes exclusive skill levels disproportionately powerful.

tips.tip: Class counters only provide 10% attack bonus, not 30%
tips.detail: Many guides overstate this. Stat bonuses and skill quality matter ~7x more than counter matchups. Don't restructure compositions just for counters.

tips.tip: T7+ Lancers can bypass Infantry to hit Marksmen directly
tips.detail: Ambusher skill: 20% chance to skip frontline and strike back-row Marksmen. T7+ Marksmen get Volley: 10% chance to attack twice. Include Lancers for anti-Marksman insurance.

tips.tip: Garrison stat bonuses come from the STRONGEST player, not the garrison leader
tips.detail: Per official Combat FAQ: the player with the highest stat bonuses is chosen as the source of defense bonuses for the entire garrison. Garrison leader controls hero lineup and formation, but stat bonus multipliers come from whoever has the best stats among all defenders. 4 primary hero skills from garrison members also activate.

tips.tip: Drill Camp syncs all heroes to your 5th-best hero's level for free
tips.detail: No daily cost. Only costs 500 gems to swap a hero out immediately instead of 24h cooldown. Investing in 5 core heroes implicitly raises your entire roster.

tips.tip: SvS casualty recovery heavily favors attacking over defending
tips.detail: Attackers recover 90% of losses via Field Triage. Defenders lose troops more permanently. Alliance strategy should favor aggressive rallies over passive garrison stacking.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Spending resources whenever the red dot appears
most_common_mistakes.correction: Ignore red dots. Save speedups/FC/Mithril for SvS Prep and Hall of Chiefs - that's where the value is.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Not shielding during SvS Battle Phase
most_common_mistakes.correction: Enemies can teleport to your state and attack. Shield up or lose troops and give them points.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Using speedups on SvS Day 3 or 4
most_common_mistakes.correction: Speedups only give points on Day 1, 2, and 5

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Ignoring Daybreak Island battle decorations
most_common_mistakes.correction: Mythic decorations give +10% Attack/Defense per decoration - huge stat source

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Skipping Tool Enhancement research at each tier
most_common_mistakes.correction: Tool Enhancement I-VII gives cumulative ~35% research speed. Do Tool Enhancement before other research at each tier.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Wrong hero in leftmost rally slot
most_common_mistakes.correction: Only leftmost hero's expedition skill applies. Use Jessie or Jeronimo.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Upgrading one Chief Gear piece to max while others lag behind
most_common_mistakes.correction: Keep all 6 pieces at SAME TIER for set bonuses. 6-piece Attack bonus helps ALL troops.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Prioritizing Lancer/Marksman Chief Gear over Infantry
most_common_mistakes.correction: Infantry engage first and form frontline. Upgrade order: Infantry (Coat/Pants) > Marksman (Belt/Weapon) > Lancer (Cap/Watch).

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Using General Hero Shards during SvS
most_common_mistakes.correction: General shards give ZERO points. Only named hero shards count.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Training new troops on SvS Day 4 with speedups
most_common_mistakes.correction: PROMOTING troops (0.64-0.71 p/s) beats speedup value (0.50 p/s). Train new = 0.39 p/s = bad.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Building Epic Daybreak decorations instead of Mythic
most_common_mistakes.correction: Epic = 2.5% max. Mythic = 10% max. Skip to Mythic for 4x the bonus.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Spending Flames outside of Flame Lotto
most_common_mistakes.correction: Save ALL Flames for Flame Lotto event. Best value per Flame by far.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Attacking during SvS without planning shield timing
most_common_mistakes.correction: Attacking drops shield for 30 min. You become a target. Time attacks with alliance coordination.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Chasing troop count / troop power as main goal
most_common_mistakes.correction: Troop power is fake power. Once you have enough for rallies, invest in Research and Essence Stones instead - permanent quality > temporary quantity.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Leaving Cookhouse on default Healthy Gruel
most_common_mistakes.correction: Switch to Fancy Meal immediately. Small meat increase, huge happiness/health boost. Tap Cookhouse > Stove > menu icon > Fancy Meal.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Letting the Furnace run out of coal
most_common_mistakes.correction: Coal burns 24/7 even offline. Keep Furnace on MAX power at all times. Survivors freeze without heat.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: R4/R5 not checking rally joiner heroes before starting
most_common_mistakes.correction: Use rally overview screen to verify every joiner's first hero and skill ratings. Boot players who don't meet requirements.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Poor Alliance Championship lane assignments
most_common_mistakes.correction: Analyze enemy setups before placing players. Strategic positioning against weaker foes wins more than raw power.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Starting a farm account in a different state than your main
most_common_mistakes.correction: Resources can only be transferred within the same state. Farms must be in the same state as your main account to be useful.

most_common_mistakes.mistake: Investing in heroes/research/gear on farm accounts
most_common_mistakes.correction: Farms are just resource generators. Only level Furnace and resource buildings. All other investment is wasted.
